greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Smallest number in the trajectory of n under repeated application of the map k -> A271497(k).
comment: It appears that every number n eventually reaches one of the loops (1,2,3), (7,14,21), (31,62,96), ..., (2^(2m)-1, 2^(2m+1)-2, 3(2^(2m)-1))), ...
link: Chai Wah Wu, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..10000
results.author: _N. J. A. Sloane_, Apr 16 2016
